alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 6:14AM CST until January 29 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Shelbyville, Manchester, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Duck River near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...From this morning to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water begins to inundate agricultural land and other low lying areas along the river including access points from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 14.3 feet and rising. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.6 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM CST.
